Job Title: Corporate Merchant Training Partner

Location: Texas, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Job Description

 Job Summary 

The Corporate Merchant Training Partner is responsible for driving the identification, build-out, and delivery of value-added merchant training and functional career-growth activities that are aligned to ongoing strategic merchandising initiatives. This position requires a strong understanding of the end-to-end merchandise cycle and experience in a learning and development role to support needs-identification, learning solution development and the execution of learning activities/programs to drive a learning culture across the merchandising organization. Candidates must have an analytical data-driven approach and creative mindset for success in this role. Reporting to the Director of Training and Talent Development, and partnering with members of the Senior Merchandising team, this position promotes and supports the Merchandising and Training and Talent Development teams in supporting the company Vision, Mission, and Core Values.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

 Defines learning solutions based on data analysis and drives the design, build-out and delivery of blended-learning experiences utilizing learning methodologies that include instructor-led training, e-learning, self-study, and experiential/stretch assignments  Takes initiative to continually improve training content and presentations in response to learner needs, changes in business practices and applicable feedback  Builds trust and maintains positive, effective working relationships with stakeholders across business units/departments and can easily work cross-functionally on assigned projects  Conducts needs assessments with Merchandising leadership to identify skill and performance gaps across all levels of the merchandising organization  Stays relevant on merchandising industry knowledge and serves as a content expert on learning and development trends related to emerging leaders, transitioning leaders, hi-potential leadership development, and change management  Monitors training regularly to ensure training is relevant, accurate and scalable  Partners with the Talent Management Analyst to conduct follow-up studies and surveys of training initiatives to evaluate effectiveness and measure results. Reports on participant performance and engagement  Manages all training logistics and communicates to learners pre/post session on all pertinent information  Ensures a best-in-class, value-added, engaging learning experience  Exhibits fiscal responsibility in maintaining costs related to merchandising training needs  Promotes and protects the At Home Brand  Other duties as assigned by supervisor 

Qualifications & Competencies

 5+ years in a merchandising role, preferably in a Buying or Planning capacity  Preferred 2+ years of training and talent development experience including needs assessment, developing learner-centered training curriculum (Instructor-led training, job-aids, self-study, etc.), workshop facilitation for various levels of corporate employees  Demonstrated success in building, delivering, and measuring high-impact learning experiences to various levels of learners  Self-motivated with the ability to effectively work in a fast-paced, collaborative, hybrid environment, and can manage multiple priorities and projects while still being detail-focused  Demonstrates strong listening, written and verbal communication skills. Able to translate information in a well thought-out, concise, and easy-to-understand manner  Embraces change and shows adaptability and resiliency to quick changes in priorities, technology, tools, and workflow. Persists when dealing with ambiguity  Engages in active problem-solving and seeks input and timely feedback to make sound decisions  Demonstrates effective organizational and time management skills  Treats others fairly and follows through on personal commitments  Knowledge of training methodologies  Proficient in MS Office, especially PowerPoint, Excel and Microsoft Teams. Additional experience with Articulate 360 a plus  Bachelor’s degree required; preferably in a related field  Additional certifications such as CPLP, DDI, Achieve Global, Certified Coaching preferred 

About Us

When you’re a part of our team, you have the full support of a diverse, close-knit team in our stores. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status. We also provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law. At Home is committed to knitting diversity and inclusion into the fabric of our culture; we respect, appreciate and celebrate the experiences and qualities that differentiate everyone on the At Home team.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
